Selecting columns and fields to download

2019-07-18

Source: vignettes/selecting-fields.Rmd
selecting-fields.Rmd
library(naturecounts)
library(dplyr)

In naturecounts, by default default data is downloaded with a specific set of fields/columns. However, for more advanced applications, users may wish to specify which fields/columns to return. The Bird Monitoring Data Exchange (BMDE) schema keeps track of variables used to augment observation data. There are different versions reflecting different collections of variables.

BMDE versions

There are several ways to get more information about these different field/columns sets.

  1. You can get a list of the different versions with the meta_bmde_versions() function.
meta_bmde_versions()
##                                             descr shorthand
## 1                                       BMDE 1.38      <NA>
## 2                                        BMDE 2.0      core
## 3                        BMDE 2.0 (extended list)  extended
## 4                              BMDE 2.0 (minimum)   minimum
## 5                   Banding extension to BMDE 2.0      <NA>
## 6 Monarch Knowledge Network extension to BMDE 2.0      <NA>
## 7               Nest record extension to BMDE 2.0      <NA>
## 8  Nest record extension (visit data) to BMDE 2.0      <NA>
##               version
## 1            BMDE1.38
## 2            BMDE2.00
## 3        BMDE2.00-ext
## 4        BMDE2.00-min
## 5      BMDE-BAND-2.00
## 6       BMDE-MKN-2.00
## 7      BMDE-NEST-2.00
## 8 BMDE-NESTVISIT-2.00
  1. You can get a list of the specific fields/columns included in each version using the meta_bmde_fields() function
meta_bmde_fields(version = "BMDE-BAND-2.00") %>%
  head()
##   field_order        version             local_name
## 1           1 BMDE-BAND-2.00 GlobalUniqueIdentifier
## 2           2 BMDE-BAND-2.00       DateLastModified
## 3           3 BMDE-BAND-2.00          BasisOfRecord
## 4           4 BMDE-BAND-2.00        InstitutionCode
## 5           5 BMDE-BAND-2.00         CollectionCode
## 6           6 BMDE-BAND-2.00          CatalogNumber
  1. You can see which BMDE versions are used by different collections by looking at the metadata associated with that collection.
meta_collections() %>% 
  head()
##    bmdr_code bmde_version project_id n_locations
## 1   ABATLAS1     BMDE2.00       1042        2209
## 2   ABATLAS2     BMDE2.00       1042        5359
## 3 ABBIRDRECS     BMDE2.00       1042       21962
## 4     ABOWLS     BMDE2.00       1012          NA
## 5      ATBBS     BMDE2.00       1033          NA
## 6     ATOWLS     BMDE2.00       1011         260
##                                                   collection_name_fr
## 1                Atlas des oiseaux nicheurs de l'Alberta (1987-1992)
## 2                Atlas des oiseaux nicheurs de l'Alberta (2000-2005)
## 3                                  Observations d'oiseaux en Alberta
## 4                       Inventaire des hiboux nocturnes de l'Alberta
## 5 Programme de surveillance des oiseaux échoués du Canada atlantique
## 6                    Inventaire des hiboux nocturnes de l'Atlantique
##   collection min_year max_year                         collection_name
## 1   ABATLAS1     1987     1991 Alberta Breeding Bird Atlas (1987-1992)
## 2   ABATLAS2     2000     2005 Alberta Breeding Bird Atlas (2000-2005)
## 3 ABBIRDRECS     1941     2006                    Alberta Bird Records
## 4     ABOWLS       NA       NA           Alberta Nocturnal Owls Survey
## 5      ATBBS       NA       NA     Atlantic Canada Beached Bird Survey
## 6     ATOWLS     2017     2017          Atlantic Nocturnal Owls Survey
##   akn_level n_records
## 1         5    123364
## 2         5    201398
## 3         5    357264
## 4         4        NA
## 5         4        NA
## 6         4       367

Specifying fields by version

By default, the BMDE2.00-min or minimum BMDE version is used when downloading data, but you can specify other versions with either the version name, or the shorthand.

cardinals <- nc_data_dl(species = 19360, fields_set = "core", username = "sample")
## Using filters: species (19360); fields_set (BMDE2.00)
## Collecting available records...
##   access  collection nrecords
## 1    yes    ABATLAS1        2
## 2    yes    ABATLAS2       13
## 3    yes  ABBIRDRECS        1
## 4    yes RCBIOTABASE       40
## Total records: 56
## 
## Downloading records for each collection:
##   ABATLAS1
##     Records 1 to 2 / 2
##   ABATLAS2
##     Records 1 to 13 / 13
##   ABBIRDRECS
##     Records 1 to 1 / 1
##   RCBIOTABASE
##     Records 1 to 40 / 40
names(cardinals)

Basic fields

Note that there are extra fields/columns downloaded in every request, which are in addition to the BMDE fields. These are additional, basic, indexed fields used in the database.

You can figure out exactly which fields these are, by removing all the fields from the core BMDE field set.

names(cardinals)[!names(cardinals) %in% meta_bmde_fields(version = "core")$local_name]
##  [1] "statprov_code"     "species_id"        "utm_square"       
##  [4] "latitude"          "bcr"               "survey_year"      
##  [7] "breeding_rank"     "project_id"        "longitude"        
## [10] "collection"        "protocol_id"       "protocol_type"    
## [13] "country_code"      "iba_site"          "survey_month"     
## [16] "SiteCode"          "subnational2_code" "survey_week"      
## [19] "survey_day"        "record_id"

Custom fields

The basic fields will always be included in any data request. However, you can choose which fields/columns to include in addition to these basic fields, by specifying fields_set = custom, and listing all additional fields.

cardinals <- nc_data_dl(species = 19360, fields_set = "custom", 
                        fields = c("Sex", "SamplingEventIdentifier"), 
                        username = "sample")
## Using filters: species (19360); fields_set (custom); fields (Sex, SamplingEventIdentifier)
## Collecting available records...
##   access  collection nrecords
## 1    yes    ABATLAS1        2
## 2    yes    ABATLAS2       13
## 3    yes  ABBIRDRECS        1
## 4    yes RCBIOTABASE       40
## Total records: 56
## 
## Downloading records for each collection:
##   ABATLAS1
##     Records 1 to 2 / 2
##   ABATLAS2
##     Records 1 to 13 / 13
##   ABBIRDRECS
##     Records 1 to 1 / 1
##   RCBIOTABASE
##     Records 1 to 40 / 40
head(cardinals)
##   species_id utm_square SiteCode Sex latitude SamplingEventIdentifier
## 1      19360    11UPT60     3103  NA 51.47389                   C0107
## 2      19360    11UPT60     3103  NA 51.47389                   C0119
## 3      19360    12UVE88    12049  NA 53.98632                    5863
## 4      19360    11UPV91    45868  NA 53.34350                   92650
## 5      19360    12UUE43    45940  NA 53.52760                   92829
## 6      19360    12UUE33    45988  NA 53.56476                   92900

Adding specific fields to a BMDE version

In a more complex example, if you wished to download data with the minimum set of BMDE fields, but including a couple of extra fields, you could combine the core fields with the extras you want, and pass them on as a custom field set.

For example, first collect the minimum field/column names.

my_fields <- meta_bmde_fields(version = "minimum")$local_name
my_fields
##  [1] "GlobalUniqueIdentifier"  "CatalogNumber"          
##  [3] "Locality"                "TimeCollected"          
##  [5] "CollectorNumber"         "FieldNumber"            
##  [7] "Remarks"                 "ProjectCode"            
##  [9] "ProtocolType"            "ProtocolCode"           
## [11] "ProtocolURL"             "SurveyAreaIdentifier"   
## [13] "SamplingEventIdentifier" "SamplingEventStructure" 
## [15] "RouteIdentifier"         "TimeObservationsStarted"
## [17] "TimeObservationsEnded"   "DurationInHours"        
## [19] "TimeIntervalStarted"     "TimeIntervalEnded"      
## [21] "TimeIntervalsAdditive"   "NumberOfObservers"      
## [23] "NoObservations"          "ObservationCount"       
## [25] "ObservationDescriptor"   "ObservationCount2"      
## [27] "ObservationDescriptor2"  "ObservationCount3"      
## [29] "ObservationDescriptor3"  "ObservationCount4"      
## [31] "ObservationDescriptor4"  "ObservationCount5"      
## [33] "ObservationDescriptor5"  "ObservationCount6"      
## [35] "ObservationDescriptor6"  "AllIndividualsReported" 
## [37] "AllSpeciesReported"

Then add in the extra fields.

my_fields <- c(my_fields, "Sex", "LifeStage")
my_fields
##  [1] "GlobalUniqueIdentifier"  "CatalogNumber"          
##  [3] "Locality"                "TimeCollected"          
##  [5] "CollectorNumber"         "FieldNumber"            
##  [7] "Remarks"                 "ProjectCode"            
##  [9] "ProtocolType"            "ProtocolCode"           
## [11] "ProtocolURL"             "SurveyAreaIdentifier"   
## [13] "SamplingEventIdentifier" "SamplingEventStructure" 
## [15] "RouteIdentifier"         "TimeObservationsStarted"
## [17] "TimeObservationsEnded"   "DurationInHours"        
## [19] "TimeIntervalStarted"     "TimeIntervalEnded"      
## [21] "TimeIntervalsAdditive"   "NumberOfObservers"      
## [23] "NoObservations"          "ObservationCount"       
## [25] "ObservationDescriptor"   "ObservationCount2"      
## [27] "ObservationDescriptor2"  "ObservationCount3"      
## [29] "ObservationDescriptor3"  "ObservationCount4"      
## [31] "ObservationDescriptor4"  "ObservationCount5"      
## [33] "ObservationDescriptor5"  "ObservationCount6"      
## [35] "ObservationDescriptor6"  "AllIndividualsReported" 
## [37] "AllSpeciesReported"      "Sex"                    
## [39] "LifeStage"

Now download the data.

cardinals <- nc_data_dl(species = 19360, fields_set = "custom", 
                        fields = my_fields, username = "sample")
## Using filters: species (19360); fields_set (custom); fields (GlobalUniqueIdentifier, CatalogNumber, Locality, TimeCollected, CollectorNumber, FieldNumber, Remarks, ProjectCode, ProtocolType, ProtocolCode, ProtocolURL, SurveyAreaIdentifier, SamplingEventIdentifier, SamplingEventStructure, RouteIdentifier, TimeObservationsStarted, TimeObservationsEnded, DurationInHours, TimeIntervalStarted, TimeIntervalEnded, TimeIntervalsAdditive, NumberOfObservers, NoObservations, ObservationCount, ObservationDescriptor, ObservationCount2, ObservationDescriptor2, ObservationCount3, ObservationDescriptor3, ObservationCount4, ObservationDescriptor4, ObservationCount5, ObservationDescriptor5, ObservationCount6, ObservationDescriptor6, AllIndividualsReported, AllSpeciesReported, Sex, LifeStage)
## Collecting available records...
##   access  collection nrecords
## 1    yes    ABATLAS1        2
## 2    yes    ABATLAS2       13
## 3    yes  ABBIRDRECS        1
## 4    yes RCBIOTABASE       40
## Total records: 56
## 
## Downloading records for each collection:
##   ABATLAS1
##     Records 1 to 2 / 2
##   ABATLAS2
##     Records 1 to 13 / 13
##   ABBIRDRECS
##     Records 1 to 1 / 1
##   RCBIOTABASE
##     Records 1 to 40 / 40
